column2: Assistant Professor in the MCA (Master of Computer Applications) program, your role is to teach and mentor students pursuing their MCA degree     You will be responsible for delivering lectures, conducting practical sessions, guiding students in their projects, and assessing their performance       Here are the key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the position of an Assistant Professor in the MCA program:       Teaching and Course Delivery: Prepare and deliver lectures on various subjects related to computer science and applications, such as programming languages, database management, software engineering, computer networks, and artificial intelligence     Use effective teaching methodologies, instructional materials, and technology tools to enhance student learning     Curriculum Development: Contribute to the development and revision of the MCA program curriculum     Design and update course syllabi, learning objectives, and assessment methods to ensure alignment with industry trends, academic standards, and student needs     Student Guidance and Mentoring: Provide guidance and mentorship to students regarding academic and career-related matters     Assist students in selecting appropriate elective courses, internships, and research projects     Offer advice on higher studies, job opportunities, and industry expectations     Project Supervision: Supervise and guide students in their research projects, dissertations, and practical assignments     Help students define project objectives, research methodologies, and implementation strategies     Provide constructive feedback and evaluation throughout the project lifecycle     Assessment and Grading: Develop and administer examinations, quizzes, and assignments to assess student knowledge and skills     Evaluate student performance objectively and provide timely feedback     Maintain accurate records of grades and attendance     Academic Research: Engage in academic research and scholarly activities in your area of expertise     Publish research papers in conferences and journals     Participate in research collaborations and contribute to the advancement of knowledge in the field of computer applications     Professional Development: Stay updated with the latest advancements in computer science and applications through continuous learning, attending conferences, workshops, and seminars     Acquire certifications and participate in faculty development programs to enhance teaching and research skills     Student Support and Counseling: Provide academic and personal support to students, addressing their concerns, and resolving issues     Offer career guidance, internships, and job placement assistance     Foster a positive and inclusive learning environment that promotes student engagement and success     Faculty Collaboration and Committees: Collaborate with colleagues and contribute to departmental activities, curriculum committees, and academic projects     Participate in faculty meetings, contribute to decision-making processes, and engage in academic initiatives     Institutional Service: Contribute to the overall development and growth of the institution     Participate in accreditation processes, committees, and institutional events     Engage in community service and promote the reputation and values of the institution

column2: The Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering invites applications for the position of Associate Professor. The selected candidate will be responsible for teaching undergraduate and graduate courses in electrical and electronics engineering and conducting research in their area of expertise.      The candidate should be able to develop innovative teaching methodologies, curriculum, and course materials, engage in academic activities such as publications and presentations, and actively participate in departmental and college committees.           Responsibilities:         Teaching: The primary responsibility of an Associate Professor is teaching undergraduate and graduate-level courses in EEE. They may also supervise student projects and mentor students in research projects.     Research: Conducting high-quality research in EEE and publishing scholarly articles in reputable academic journals is a significant responsibility of an Associate Professor. They may also apply for grants to fund their research activities.     Service: Serving on departmental and university committees, participating in professional organizations, reviewing research proposals, and serving as a peer reviewer for academic journals are all service-related responsibilities of an Associate Professor.     Advising: Providing academic advising to undergraduate and graduate students in EEE, including course selection, career guidance, and guidance on research projects.     Curriculum Development: Participating in the development and evaluation of the EEE curriculum and programs, including designing new courses and updating existing courses to reflect changes in the field.     Collaboration: Collaborating with colleagues in EEE and related fields to advance research, teaching, and outreach activities.     Professional Development: Staying up-to-date with the latest research and developments in EEE, attending conferences, and publishing scholarly work.     Supervision: Supervising graduate students, post-doctoral researchers, and research assistants working in their research projects.     Outreach: Engaging in outreach activities, such as community service, industry partnerships, and public lectures to promote the departments mission and goals.         Qualifications:         Ph.D. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering or a related field from an accredited institution.      At least 5 years of teaching experience at the undergraduate and graduate levels in a reputable institution.      Demonstrated research and publication record in electrical and electronics engineering or a related field.      Ability to develop and teach courses in areas such as power electronics, power systems, control systems, renewable energy, signal processing, and communication engineering. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.      Experience in mentoring and supervising students in research projects.      Demonstrated commitment to academic excellence, research, and innovation.         Eligible fielfs:         Power Electronics     Power Systems     Control Systems     Renewable Energy     Signal Processing     Communication Engineering     Electromagnetic Fields and Waves     Robotics and Automation     Instrumentation and Measurements     Microelectronics     Computer-Aided Design and Simulation         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate

column2: Dear Applicant,  We have New Life Skills Course of 2 Credit in B.Tech CSE for which we are all looking forward to have a full time faculty. Same faculty will also help our students in improving their communication skills required for the placement. Total Load: 40 Hrs For the same we require faculty on full time basis so that we can fully justify the outcome of this course which is very important from placement point of view. COURSE SUMMARY This course aims at teaching students to increase awareness regarding ones role in improving ones quality of life. They will be able to appreciate knowledge about positive outcomes of specific ways of thinking, such as assertiveness and positive and proactive thinking. This course shall help the students to develop and appreciate self-esteem, self[1]management. The course introduces students to the concept of stress management and strategies to overcome the same. The course also puts forward the highly appreciated concepts of emotional intelligence, leadership, team building and motivation.  COURSE-SPECIFIC LEARNING OUTCOMES (CO) By the end of this program, students should have the following knowledge, skills and values:  CO1: Express their role in improving their quality of life.  CO2: Understand human psychology and its applications to improve human achievements and happiness to substantial extent.  CO3: Reflect on the aspects of leadership, motivation and stress management.  CO4: Appreciate the nature of positive and proactive thinking and assertiveness.  CO5: Apply concepts, tools and frameworks of emotional intelligence and stress management. Interested candidates can apply at career@bennett.edu.in with the subject line "Application-Life Skills"

Job Description for the Position of Assistant Professor We are searching for a well-organized, trustworthy assistant professor to join our excellent faculty. The assistant professors responsibilities include teaching a requisite number of classes, providing guidance and supervision to graduate students, participating in departmental meetings, and providing academic support to Professors and other faculty members. You should be able to pace your lessons and publish articles regularly. To be successful as an assistant professor, you should thrive in a fast-paced, highly competitive environment and be able to respond to criticism maturely. Outstanding candidates are able to learn from senior staff as well as students and are constantly expanding their subject knowledge. Assistant Professor Responsibilities: Assisting with various departmental duties and providing academic support to Professors and other staff. Conducting research and publishing papers in academic journals. Representing the university at conferences and delivering presentations when necessary. Teaching and supervising undergraduate and postgraduate students. Providing demonstrations and supervising experiments and investigations. Answering questions in class or via email or telephone. Providing Professors and Department Heads with feedback on student progress. Writing proposals to secure funding for research. Attending faculty and departmental meetings and voicing concerns or providing suggestions for improvement. Additional responsibilities as assigned by the concerned head on a timely basis. A good record of attending conferences and academic events. Excellent research, writing, and interpersonal skills. A passion for teaching and engaging with students. Outstanding candidates have excellent management knowledge, networking skills, and the ability to build strong professional relationships with both students and colleagues. Assisting with the training and recruitment of new lecturers, teaching assistants, and Professors. Conducting research, publishing papers, and attending conferences. Responsibilities:         Teach undergraduate and graduate courses in the field of History     Maintain an active research program and publish in scholarly journals and books     Advise and mentor students, including supervising undergraduate and graduate thesis projects     Participate in departmental and institutional service, such as serving on committees, advising student organizations, and contributing to curriculum development     Seek external funding to support research and other scholarly activities     Engage in ongoing professional development and participate in national and international conferences           Qualifications:             A PhD in History or a related field         A strong record of research and publication in the field of History         Demonstrated excellence in teaching and mentorship         The ability to work effectively in a collaborative and supportive environment                 Fields of Eligibility:              Ancient history         Medieval history         Modern history         World history         European history         American history         Asian history         African history               Note:                   Salary for all positions will be based on q         qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate
column11: Professor, Training, Publishing, Curriculum development, Mentor, Research, Supervision, Teaching

column2: An Assistant Professor is a full-time academic position in a college or university, responsible for teaching, conducting research, and serving on committees     They play a critical role in contributing to the intellectual life of their institution and in preparing the next generation of professionals and leaders       Responsibilities:       Teach a range of courses in the department, at both the undergraduate and graduate levels     Conduct original research in the field and publish findings in academic journals and at conferences     Advise students and mentor junior faculty members     Participate in department and university-wide committees, such as curriculum committees and search committees     Pursue external funding opportunities to support research and teaching activities     Engage in professional development activities to stay current in the field and enhance teaching skills       Requirements:       A record of successful teaching and research, with a strong publication record in academic journals     Ability to teach a range of courses in the department, at both the undergraduate and graduate levelsStrong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to mentor students and junior faculty members     A commitment to continued professional development and growth
column11: Medicinal chemistry, Renewable energy, Thermal engineering, Neural networks, Associate Professor, Inorganic chemistry, Effort estimation, Assistant Professor, Bioinformatics, Synthetic organic chemistry

column2: Education Qualification-      Graduation- B.Tech/B.E. (CSE/IT)    Post-Graduation- M.Tech/M.E./M.S. (CSE/IT/Software Systems) any other computer science field    Ph.D. in any Computer Science Field (Ph.D. completion is mandatory for applying)    Specialization- AI Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Cyber Security, Algorithms, Information Systems, Full Stack Development, Java, OOPS Programming, Cloud Computing, IoT, Robotics.        Experience-      For Assistant Professor- 0 to 8 years of Full-Time Teaching Experience.        Candidate Profile-      Suitable candidate should be aware of the technologies like Python, C#, Microsoft Azure, AWS, Big Data, PowerBi, etc. and should be able to work in new technologies of Computer Science like Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Data Science, Cloud computing, Block Chain or AR/VR.        Roles and Responsibilities-      1. Develop and implement innovative instructional methods.    2. Develop professional logistics to improvise student performance.    3. Guide, lead and mentor students in research projects.    4. Evaluate, monitor and mentor student academic progress.    5. Create, innovate and implement career-enhancement programs and activities.    6. Supervise and support teaching assistants.    7. Participate in departmental and college activities.    8. Serve and support functional activities of departmental committees.    9. Assess, review and evaluate student activities and progress.

column2: The Associate Professor, Department of Pedagogy of Economics, will be a key member of the faculty at JKKN College of Education. The successful candidate will be responsible for teaching and developing courses in the field of pedagogy of economics, as well as contributing to the research and scholarship activities of the department. Additionally, the Associate Professor will be responsible for advising students, participating in departmental and college-wide committees, and serving as a mentor to junior faculty.           Qualifications   :       An earned doctorate degree in Economics Education or a related field     A strong record of scholarly research and publication in the field of pedagogy of economics     A minimum of 5 years of teaching experience at the university level     Evidence of excellence in teaching, demonstrated through student evaluations and peer evaluations     A commitment to the vision and mission of JKKN College of Education     Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds         Responsibilities:         Teach and develop courses in the field of pedagogy of economics     Contribute to research and scholarship activities in the department     Advise students on academic and professional matters     Participate in departmental and college-wide committees     Serve as a mentor to junior faculty     Stay current in the field through continuous professional development and engagement in scholarly activities     Demonstrate a commitment to student success and promoting the vision and mission of JKKN College of Education     Collaborate effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds in a team environment.             Eligible Fields:         Economic Education Pedagogy     Curriculum Design and Development in Economics Education     Assessment and Evaluation in Economics Education     Application of Technology in Economics Education         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate.
column11: Economics, Publishing, Associate Professor, Junior Faculty, Manager Technology, Mentor, Research, Teaching

column2: As a Tele Caller or Call Representative, your role is to make outbound calls or receive inbound calls on behalf of your organization     You typically work in a customer service or sales environment, where you engage with customers or prospects over the phone     Here are some key aspects of your role:Making Outbound Calls: You make proactive outbound calls to customers or leads to initiate conversations, provide information, or promote products or services     This may involve cold calling to reach potential customers and generate sales or gather market intelligence     Receiving Inbound Calls: You handle incoming calls from customers or clients, addressing their inquiries, resolving issues, or providing assistance     You ensure prompt and professional responses to enhance customer satisfaction     Customer Service: You provide excellent customer service by actively listening to customer needs, addressing their concerns, and providing appropriate solutions or guidance     You strive to create positive experiences and build strong relationships with customers

column2: Job Title :   Assistant Professor - Computer Science (Various Domains) Job Role:   Full Time Job Location:   GLA University Mathura Campus Overview: We are actively seeking accomplished individuals with a Ph.D. in Computer Science to join our esteemed faculty as Assistant Professors. This position is designed for candidates who have completed their Ph.D. and are committed to ongoing research pursuits. As an Assistant Professor, you will contribute to our academic community through teaching, research, and service while pursuing additional scholarly activities. Eligibility Criteria BE/ B.Tech and ME/ MTech in computer science with first class in any one of the degrees. Ph.D. degree awarded or at least thesis submitted will be preferred. Responsibilities: 1. Teaching and Curriculum Development: - Deliver high-quality and engaging undergraduate and/or graduate courses in computer science. - Contribute to the development and enhancement of curriculum content. - Provide mentorship and guidance to students in academic and research endeavors. 2. Research and Scholarship: - Conduct impactful and innovative research in a specific domain of computer science. - Publish research findings in reputable conferences and journals. - Collaborate with fellow faculty members and students on research projects. 3. Advising and Student Engagement: - Advise and mentor students on academic and career-related matters. - Foster a positive and inclusive learning environment through active engagement with students. 4. Service and Collaboration: - Participate in departmental and university-wide committees and activities. - Collaborate with colleagues on departmental initiatives and interdisciplinary research. 5. Professional Development: - Pursue continuous professional development to stay current with advancements in the field. - Attend and contribute to conferences, workshops, and seminars. Perks & Benefits: - Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. - Opportunities for professional development and research. - A supportive and collaborative work environment.
column11: Professor Activities, Elearning Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Curriculum Development, Software Engineering, Teaching

column2: An Assistant Professor is a full-time academic position in a college or university, responsible for teaching, conducting research, and serving on committees     They play a critical role in contributing to the intellectual life of their institution and in preparing the next generation of professionals and leaders       Responsibilities:       Teach a range of courses in the department, at both the undergraduate and graduate levels     Conduct original research in the field and publish findings in academic journals and at conferences     Advise students and mentor junior faculty members     Participate in department and university-wide committees, such as curriculum committees and search committees     Pursue external funding opportunities to support research and teaching activities     Engage in professional development activities to stay current in the field and enhance teaching skills       Requirements:       A record of successful teaching and research, with a strong publication record in academic journals     Ability to teach a range of courses in the department, at both the undergraduate and graduate levels     Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to mentor students and junior faculty members     A commitment to continued professional development and growth

column2: Assistant/Associate Professor in Politics/Economics Location : K L University-Vijayawada Role Description for Assistant/Associate Professor in Political Science This is a full-time on-site role for an Assistant Professor of Poltical Science at K L University. The Assistant Professor /Associate Professor in  Political science   will be responsible for teaching, research, and contributing to curriculum development and course design. Other day-to-day tasks associated with the role include mentoring and advising students and participating in departmental and university activities and service.   Desired Skillset Applicants should preferably hold a Ph.D. in the relevant subject from reputed Institutions. Should have sufficient experience in Teaching, Industry & Research with reputed Institutions. Should have research papers published in International / National Journals. Should have books published and Scholars awarded / currently working for. Applicants with patents registered / consultancy works carried out will be given preference. Exposure in handling high-value funded projects will be an added advantage Areas of Specializations: Political Science Public Administration International Relations Experience 5 to 10 years in teaching and research in Political Science.   Role Description for Assistant/Associate Professor in Economics: This is a full-time role for a Faculty of Economics/Econometrics at KL University. The Faculty of Economics/Econometrics will be responsible for teaching economics and econometrics courses, advising students, conducting research, and participating in departmental activities. Qualifications Ph.D. in Economics/Econometrics Good communication and interpersonal skills Experience 5 to 10 years in teaching and research in Economics/Econometrics   Interested candidates kindly share your updated CV's to bmeenasupriya@kluniversity.in for any enquiries please reach us on 910054787 - B M.Supriya  Manager-HR - KL University

column1: Professor / Associate Professor / Assistant Professor - Management
column2: NIET is looking to hire faculty members  (Assistant Professor/ Associate Professor /Professor) for MBA and PGDM department  for our Campus in Greater Noida (National Capital Region). Faculty members who are possessing relevant experience and qualification as per AICTE norms are welcomed to apply for these positions. Candidates with specialization in  Logistic & Supply Management, Financial Management, Digital Marketing, Business Analytics, Customer Relationship Management, etc  will be preferred Role & responsibilities     Teaching:  Deliver high-quality teaching in courses related to Financial Management, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, CRM, and Business Analytics at both undergraduate and graduate levels. Development and revitalization of courses and curriculum may also be required. Research:  Conduct and publish cutting-edge research in peer-reviewed journals. The candidate is expected to develop a research portfolio that complements and enhances the department's existing strengths, obtaining external funding as applicable. Service:  Participate in departmental, college-level, and university-wide committees. Engage in service roles that contribute to the governance and advancement of the academic community. Advising:  Provide guidance and mentorship to students, advising on academic, career, and research paths. Collaboration:  Work collaboratively with faculty in interdisciplinary programs across the university. Engage with industry professionals and participate in conferences to stay abreast of the latest developments in the field. Preferred candidate profile   Education:  As per AICTE norms. Candidates completed their PhD in Management, Business Administration, or a closely related field with a focus on Financial Management, Supply Chain Management, Logistic, CRM, or Business Analytics will be highly preferred. Candidates nearing the completion of their doctorate may also be considered. Experience:  Demonstrated potential for excellence in teaching and research. Prior teaching experience and a record of publications in reputable journals in the field are highly desirable. Skills:  Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with proficiency in using various analytical tools and software relevant to the field. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Perks and benefits   Best in the Industry. Salary as per AICTE & UGC norms. Interested candidate may apply for this position or may send their resume at  recruitment@niet.co.in / chetan.teotia@niet.co.in  along with following information:- Current Salary:- Expected Salary:- Notice Period:- Area of Specialization:- Willingness for Greater Noida:-

column2: Westford is seeking for a full-time professionals as Associate Faculties. Apart from delivering lectures, the selected candidate will also be expected to deliver presentations in classrooms, seminar and/or conduct varied relevant workshop and engage in management and development of teaching and learning strategies and academic standards. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience: 15 Years in Teaching/ Research, out of which 5 years must be at the Level of Associate Professor & 2 Years at the level of Professor. 2. Associate Professor Qualification: Ph.D & First Class Masters Degree or equivalent qualification. Experience: 10 Years in Teaching/ Research. Out of which minimum 2 years at the Level of Associate Professor. 3. Assistant Professor Qualification: First Class Masters Degree or equivalent with mandatory UGC NET qualification. Experience: Atleast 2 years of teaching Experience is mandatory. Retired Professors of repute may also apply. Salary no bar for Excellent Candidates. Note: Salary as per UGC / AICTE / BCI norms Salary as per 7th Pay norms for qualified candidates.

column2: The English Associate Professor in the Department of Science and Humanities at JKKN College of Engineering and Technology is a full-time faculty position that provides academic leadership in the field of English. The successful candidate will be responsible for teaching and advising students, conducting scholarly research, and contributing to the departments vision and mission.           Responsibilities:         Teach undergraduate and graduate courses in English language and literature.     Advise and mentor students on academic and personal matters.     Conduct original research in the field of English and publish in peer-reviewed journals.     Contribute to the departments goals and initiatives, such as curriculum development and student success programs.     Engage in professional service activities, such as participating in departmental committees and serving as a reviewer for academic journals.     Foster a supportive and inclusive learning environment for students of diverse backgrounds.             Qualifications:         A PhD or equivalent degree in English or a related field.     A strong record of scholarly research and publication in the field of English.     Demonstrated experience as an effective teacher and mentor to undergraduate and graduate students.     Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues in the department and across the college.     A commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of the job.             Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate

Formulating the most prestigious and well-balanced academic program that encourages research as well as addresses the industry's needs Articulating and promoting scholarly excellence culminating into meaningful products and services for the marketplace and society Improvising and adopting the best practices from the top universities and corporations in the world Providing leadership to earn recognition for the department, including participation in conferences, events, and competitions Establishing a strong internship and placement program within the department Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to fiscal planning, resource allocation, performance evaluations, cultivating a vibrant work culture, etc Eligibility   M.Tech /MCA or Ph.D. Published works would be advantageous. Strong analytical, observational, and problem-solving skills. Excellent research, writing, and interpersonal skills. A passion for teaching/training/research and engaging with students.

Work with colleagues to develop or modify the curriculum for a degree or certificate program involving a series of courses. Assess students??progress by grading papers, tests, and other work. Stay informed about changes and innovations in their field. Conduct research and experiments to advance knowledge in their field.

column2: Job Description:  ? Organize and implement an instructional program ? Identify, choose and implement different teaching methods for all students with various educational backgrounds ? Transfer to students theoretical information, practical skills, methods and techniques ? Provide a positive and honest environment for students during class hours ? Use media equipment to sustain your course ? Establish and maintain good relationships with the college staff, students and their parents ? Stimulate analytical and rational thinking ? Supervise student's projects ? Examine and give students a feedback about their academic activity ? Develop and implement a research strategy in a certain field ? Participate and coordinate research activities ? Handle student's problems ? Act as tutor and offer them moral support ? Counsel them concerning their educational development and career choosing Required skills:  ? Excellent written and oral communication skills ? Very good interpersonal skills ? Academic leadership At least 4+ years of experience.

column2: Assistant Professor of Management:An Assistant Professor is typically a junior faculty member who is in the early stages of their academic career     They often hold a doctoral degree (Ph.D.or equivalent) in a relevant field, such as Management, Business Administration, or a related discipline     Responsibilities include teaching undergraduate and possibly graduate-level courses in Management, conducting research, publishing scholarly articles, and participating in departmental and university service     Assistant Professors are expected to establish themselves as promising researchers and educators in their field     Associate Professor of Management:An Associate Professor is a mid-level faculty position that is usually achieved through promotion from the Assistant Professor rank     It signifies a higher level of experience and accomplishment     In addition to teaching and research responsibilities, Associate Professors are expected to have a track record of quality research publications, contributions to the field, and engagement in academic service     They often have a more significant role in curriculum development, program administration, and mentoring junior faculty and graduate students     Professor of Management:The title of Professor is the highest academic rank and is achieved through a combination of significant research contributions, excellence in teaching, and substantial academic leadership     Professors have a strong record of research, often evidenced by a substantial number of high-impact publications, influential contributions to the field, and recognition by peers     They are also expected to provide leadership within their department and the academic community, participate in university governance, and mentor junior faculty and graduate students
column11: Management Associate, PDF, Associate Professor, Assistant Professor, Management, Research, Teaching

column2: Teach courses in their subject area. Work with students who are studying for a degree or a certificate or certification or are taking classes to improve their knowledge or career skills. Plan lessons and assignments. Work with colleagues to develop or modify the curriculum for a degree or certificate program involving a series of courses. Assess students? progress by grading papers, tests, and other work. Stay informed about changes and innovations in their field. Conduct research and experiments to advance knowledge in their field. Serve on academic and administrative committees that review and recommend policies, make budget decisions, or advise on hiring and promotions within their department.

column2: Job Description:      The candidate should have worked in the capacity of a senior faculty member     Must have passion for academic, institutional and student development pursuits     Should have offered courses to students in the core area of expertise     Should have been consistently involved in applied research and publications in reputed journals     Should display evidence of ?integrative thinking? in academic work     Should have contributed in institutional development and building by way of involvement in organizing international and national level conferences, workshops and conclaves     Should have proven leadership qualities

column2: Responsible for teaching/mentoring undergraduate and postgraduate students         The faculty member will be responsible for teaching/monitoring/advising/ provide research and service for the university.         Strong communication skills and effective teaching pedagogy techniques are necessary.         Must be effective in handling extra-curricular activities.         Self-inclined towards bringing laurels and honor to the department or university.       To contribute in research and development to establish the centre of excellence.     Desired Candidate Profile:       PhD degree in the relevant field         Bachelors - Relevant field (Must).         Masters - Relevant field (Must).         2-5 years teaching experience as Assistant Professor.         Research Publications in the relevant field are desirable.         Excellent verbal/ written communication skills.         Stronghold on fundamental basics of the subject.         Candidates having their PhD thesis submitted may apply.         UGC NET qualified candidate.
column11: Associate Professor, Assistant Professor, Research, Monitoring, Teaching

column2: Main responsibilities ??Organize and implement an instructional program. ??Identify, choose and implement different teaching methods for all students with various educational backgrounds. ??Transfer to student?? theoretical information, practical skills, methods and techniques. ??Provide a positive and honest environment for students during class hours. ??Use media equipment to sustain your course. ??Establish and maintain good relationships with the college staff, students and their parents. ??Stimulate analytical and rational thinking. ??Supervise student's projects. ??Examine and give students a feedback about their academic activity. ??Develop and implement a research strategy in a certain field. ??Participate and coordinate research activities. ??Write publications about your research activity. ??Sustain presentations at national and international conferences. ??Participate at college fairs. ??Handle student's problems. ??Act as tutor and offer them moral support. ??Counsel them concerning their educational development and career choosing. Required skills ??Excellent written and oral communication skills. ??Very good interpersonal skills. ??Intercultural competences. ??Professional appearance and presentation skills. ??Computer proficiency. ??Academic leadership. ??Problem solving capabilities. ??Highly organized and efficient in time management. ??Responsible and reliable.
column11: Counselor, Mentor, Trainer, Advisor, Educator, Teaching

column2: Job Description ?? Teach courses in their subject area ?? Work with students who are studying for a degree or a certificate or certification or are taking classes to improve their knowledge or career skills ?? Develop an instructional plan (known as a course outline or syllabus) for the course(s) they teach and ensure that it meets college and department standards ?? Plan lessons and assignments ?? Work with colleagues to develop or modify the curriculum for a degree or certificate program involving a series of courses ?? Assess students??progress by grading papers, tests, and other work ?? Advise students about which classes to take and how to achieve their goals ?? Stay informed about changes and innovations in their field ?? Conduct research and experiments to advance knowledge in their field ?? Supervise graduate students who are working toward doctoral degrees ?? Publish original research and analysis in books and academic journals ?? Serve on academic and administrative committees that review and recommend policies, make budget decisions, or advise on hiring and promotions within their department.
column11: Counselor, Mentor, Trainer, Advisor, Educator, Teaching

column2: Responsibilities include preparing stimulating lessons, identifying and analyzing student needs, strengths, and weaknesses, overseeing experiments, as well as setting and grading assessments. Ensuring faculty development and overall management.            DUTIES RESPONSIBILITIES          Be responsible and accountable for setting and advancing the academic strategy of the Department in line with Faculty and University strategic plans and direction.          Be an active member of the Faculty Executive Board and contribute to the overall leadership and management of the Faculty: it is expected that Heads of Department will carry functional responsibility for specific agreed cross-cutting Faculty areas.          Develop and sustain appropriate structures for management, consultation, decision-making and communication with staff and students.          Promote and represent the University both internally and externally          Refresh and develop new programmes in order to attract new students and markets.          Conduct research in a particular field of knowledge and publish findings in professional journals, books.          Keep abreast of developments in the field by reading current literature, discussing with colleagues, and participating in professional conferences.          Supervise undergraduate or graduate teaching, internship, and research work.          Collaborate with colleagues to address teaching and research related issues in the Department.          Provide industrial exposure to the students at all stages through their registration, internship, recruitment and placement activities.          Compile bibliographies of specialized materials for outside reading assignments.          Serve on academic or administrative committees that deal with institutional policies.          SKILLS ABILITIES          Excellent written and verbal communication skills.          Combine several pieces of information and draw conclusions.          Identify what must be changed to reach goals.          Excellent interpersonal skills          Presentation and Organization Skills          Initiative and Confidence          Basic IT skills
column11: Administration, Interpersonal skills, Associate Professor, IT skills, Management, Research, Internship, Recruitment, Teaching

Additional Qualification:    NET/SLET, Doctorate

column2: The Physics Associate Professor will play a crucial role in achieving the colleges vision and mission by teaching and inspiring students in the field of physics. Engaging in professional development activities, such as attending conferences and workshops.     Collaborating with other researchers both within and outside of the university.     Participating in community outreach and public speaking events to promote the field of physics.             Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate.

column2: The Department of Information Technology invites applications for the position of Associate Professor. The selected candidate will be responsible for teaching undergraduate and graduate courses in information technology and conducting research in their area of expertise. The candidate should be able to develop innovative teaching methodologies, curriculum, and course materials, engage in academic activities such as publications and presentations, and actively participate in departmental and college committees.           Responsibilities:         Teaching: An Associate Professor in IT is responsible for teaching courses related to their area of expertise. This can include both undergraduate and graduate level courses.     Research: An Associate Professor in IT is expected to conduct original research in their field, publish scholarly articles in peer-reviewed journals, and present research findings at conferences.     Advising and mentoring: Associate Professors are often called upon to advise and mentor students in their field of study, particularly graduate students who may be working on their thesis or dissertation.     Service: Associate Professors in IT are expected to serve on committees within their department or university, and may also be involved in professional organizations related to their field.     Collaboration: Associate Professors in IT are expected to collaborate with colleagues within their department and university, as well as with researchers at other institutions.     Outreach and community engagement: Some Associate Professors in IT may be involved in outreach and community engagement activities, such as working with local schools or community organizations to promote STEM education.     Administration: In some cases, Associate Professors in IT may also have administrative responsibilities, such as serving as department chair or program director.         Qualifications:         Ph.D. in Information Technology or a related field from an accredited institution.      At least 5 years of teaching experience at the undergraduate and graduate levels in a reputable institution.      Demonstrated research and publication record in information technology or a related field.      Ability to develop and teach courses in areas such as software engineering, artificial intelligence, data analytics, cyber security, and mobile computing.      Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.      Experience in mentoring and supervising students in research projects.      Demonstrated commitment to academic excellence, research, and innovation.         Eligible fields:         Software Engineering     Artificial Intelligence     Machine Learning     Data Analytics     Cyber Security     Mobile Computing     Cloud Computing     Computer Networks     Information Management     Human-Computer Interaction     Natural Language Processing     Computer Vision         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate

column2: The Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering invites applications for the position of Associate Professor. The selected candidate will be responsible for teaching undergraduate and graduate courses in electronics and communication engineering and conducting research in their area of expertise. This includes writing research papers and articles, presenting at conferences, and obtaining research funding.     Advising: An associate professor is expected to advise and mentor undergraduate and graduate students in ECE. They are responsible for guiding students through their academic programs, providing career advice, and supervising research projects.     Service: An associate professor is expected to serve the academic community by participating in departmental and university committees, contributing to academic governance, and providing peer review for research papers and grant proposals.     Outreach: An associate professor is expected to engage in outreach activities to promote ECE to the wider community. Demonstrated research and publication record in electronics and communication engineering or a related field. column2: Teaching: Assistant Professors are primarily responsible for delivering high-quality instruction to undergraduate and/or graduate students in their area of expertise      This includes developing syllabi, creating course materials, delivering lectures, conducting seminars, and assessing student performance      Research: Assistant Professors are expected to engage in scholarly research or creative activities in their field      They may be required to publish research papers, articles, or books and seek external funding for research projects      Research contributions often play a significant role in career advancement      Mentoring: Assist in mentoring and advising students, including guiding them on academic and career matters      This may involve supervising graduate student research projects, serving on thesis or dissertation committees, and offering guidance for academic and career development      Service: Participate in departmental and university committees, attend faculty meetings, and contribute to the academic community by engaging in service activities      This could involve reviewing grant applications, serving on academic boards, or organizing academic events      Professional Development: Keep up-to-date with developments in their field through continued research, attending conferences, and networking with colleagues      Assistant Professors are expected to continuously develop their expertise
column11: Economics, Plant pathology, Horticulture, Associate Professor, Entomology, Agronomy, Genetics, Soil science, Assistant Professor, Floriculture

column1: Lecturer / Assistant / Associate Professor Library Science
column2: Arunachal University of Studies is looking for Lecturer / Assistant / Associate Professor Library Science to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.      Teaching and Curriculum Development:Develop and deliver courses in library science, covering topics like information organization, cataloging, digital libraries, research methodologies, etc      Create engaging lesson plans, lectures, and learning materials, and assess student performance      Research and Scholarly Activities:Conduct research in areas related to library science, publishing scholarly articles, papers, or books, contributing to the academic knowledge base      Apply for grants and funding to support research initiatives within the field      Mentoring and Advising:Mentor students, provide academic advising, and supervise thesis or dissertation work for graduate students pursuing library science degrees      Guide students in their academic and professional development      Professional Service and Engagement:Engage in professional activities, such as serving on academic committees, participating in conferences, and contributing to professional associations      Collaborate with other faculty members, librarians, and stakeholders to enhance the library science curriculum and programs      Library Management and Administration:Provide expertise in library management, administration, and technological advancements within library systems      Offer guidance on library policy development, collection management, and information access          Qualifications:Education:          A PhD in Library Science, Information Science, or a related field is often required for higher academic positions (Associate Professor)      A Master's degree might suffice for Lecturer or Assistant Professor roles      Expertise: In-depth knowledge of library science principles, information organization, cataloging systems, information retrieval, digital libraries, and emerging technologies in library sciences      Teaching Experience: Prior experience in teaching or instructional roles, preferably at the university level, along with a strong record of scholarly contributions      Communication Skills: Effective communication and presentation skills for teaching, advising students, and collaborating with colleagues      Research and Publications: Demonstrated research capabilities with a record of publications in peer-reviewed journals or academic conferences
column11: Library science, Publishing, Library management, Associate Professor, Curriculum development, Collection management, Information retrieval, Assistant Professor, Research, Teaching

column2: Qualification      B.Arch., M.Arch., and Ph.D.   Specialization in    Digital Architecture, Environmental Architecture, Urban Design, Landscape Design, Urban Planning, Construction Management.   Key requirements      Good academic record with at least 60% marks (or an equivalent grade in a seven-point scale wherever grading system is followed) at the Master?? Degree level in a relevant subject.     Good academic record with a Ph.D. Degree in the relevant disciplines.     Curriculum development     Academic administration     Student Mentoring     Knowledge and Skills Required      A keen sense of enquiry to result in innovation with a view to create an impact     A teacher-researcher (or vise-versa) with an openness to attain proficiency in the other area     A willingness to unlearn and re-learn     Faith and commitment to an interdisciplinary approach to learning and teaching     Well networked with respected senior academicians in ones area of interest both in India and abroad     Experience in and/or keenness towards Institution building activities     Excitement about research towards offering composite solutions to the industry     Connecting closely with the industry with a view to swiftly adapt syllabus and/or content and in so doing, making our students job ready and distinctly unique viz-a viz their peers     Create and deliver globally relevant courses with emphasis on experiential learning     Collaborative approach towards learning, teaching, research and functioning.     Be instrumental in challenging the way students think, learn and develop their understanding of academic disciplines.     Develop core curriculum and deliver course material effectively.     Publishing research, attending conferences, and delivering presentations to build a strong research network.     Writing proposals to secure research funding.     Organizing seminars and events to interact with established industry professionals.     Reviewing methods and teaching materials to make recommendations for improvement.     Supervising, advising and mentoring teaching assistants and graduate students.     Guiding and mentoring research scholars.

column1: Job For Assistant Professor Prosthodontics (Dentistry) in Malaysia
column2: Dear Dr,     This is MD Nasir Khan and I am writing on behalf of Convate reputed Recruitment Consultant firm located in Bangalore. We offer recruitment solutions to almost all the top of the order IT organizations, Non  IT, Healthcare , Pharma & MNCs having their presence in India & Middle East.     We do have urgent job opening for Assistant Professor Prosthodontics (Dentistry) in Reputed University at Malaysia     Designation:   Assistant Professor Prosthodontics (Dentistry) Qualification:  Must have Masters Degree. PhD is an added advantage  Experience:   Minimum 3 years Preferred Notice Period-2 months (Immediate joiners would be given first priority) Location-MUCM, Melaka, Malaysia. Candidates from different parts of Malaysia must be willing to relocate to Melaka. The role is purely academic with no scope of internal practice,  but local candidate can practice with special approval beyond office hours.     If you are interested, kindly share your updated CV to cg15@convate.com or Whats App to +91 7679334046 with below details.     Kindly fill the below details: 1. Reason for job change: 2. Current Salary: 3. Expected Salary: 4. Joining Time needed     Awaiting your reply. Also do you have any friends interested in this position do refer them.     Hope to hear from you soon.     Regards, MD Nasir Khan Convate Consultancy

Dept of Computer Science (CS) Engineering Dept of Information Science (IS) Engineering Dept of Computer Science - AI and ML Engineering Dept of Computer Science - Data Science Engineering Desired Candidate Profile Assistant Professors / Freshers with M. E. / M. Tech. / M. S. or Integrated M. Tech in Computer Science (CS) / Information Science (IS) / Information Technology (IT) / Artificial Intelligence (AI) / Machine Learning (ML) / Data Science (DS). Only applicants who are interested to work from Institution Campus (Offline) need to apply. Teaching Demo and Technical Interview will be held Online or Offline in Bengaluru Campus. Shortlisted Applicants need to join us immediately (or max within 60 days). Applicants looking for only Online / Work from Home Opportunities permanently will not be considered for this role. This is a scheduled Interview drive (Online and Offline Interview). This requirement is for Bengaluru Location. We dont offer or confirm selection to any candidate without Direct (Face to Face) Offline Interview (atleast 1 round of discussion) in Bengaluru. Note:  All HoD, Professors, Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Teaching Assistants are recruited on the payroll of the Institution. Recruitment is done directly and also through Consultants. All recruitments will be on the payroll of the Institution. Candidates need not pay any Fee / Charges to any Consultant for Registration / Placement fee.

To supervise student projects, field trips and, where appropriate, placements.  To set, mark and assess work and examinations and provide feedback to students. column2: The job description for an Assistant Professor in academia typically includes a variety of responsibilities related to teaching, research, and service to the institution     While specific requirements can vary based on the university, department, and field of study, here's a general overview of what an Assistant Professor's job description might entail:Teaching Responsibilities:Course Development: Design and develop courses in their area of expertise, creating syllabi, course materials, and assignments     Classroom Instruction: Conduct lectures, lead discussions, and facilitate hands-on learning experiences     Student Support: Provide academic advising and mentorship to students, guiding them in their studies and research projects     Assessment: Evaluate student performance through exams, papers, presentations, and other forms of assessment     Innovation: Integrate innovative teaching methods and technologies into the classroom to enhance the learning experience     Research Responsibilities:Research Projects: Conduct original research in their field, leading to publications in peer-reviewed journals, conference presentations, and other scholarly works     Funding: Seek external funding through grants and research proposals to support research endeavors     Collaboration: Collaborate with other researchers, both within the institution and externally, fostering a culture of research and scholarly activity     Service to the Institution and Profession:Committee Work: Serve on academic and administrative committees within the department and university, contributing to decision-making processes     Professional Development: Engage in ongoing professional development activities, such as attending conferences, workshops, and seminars     Community Engagement: Contribute to the community through outreach programs, public lectures, or partnerships with local organizations     Peer Review: Review manuscripts, grant proposals, or other scholarly works for peer-reviewed journals and funding agencies     Qualifications:Education: A doctoral degree in the relevant field is typically required     Experience: Demonstrated excellence in teaching and research, often supported by a record of publications and presentations     Expertise: In-depth knowledge and expertise in a specific area of the discipline     Communication: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both in teaching and professional interactions     Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and students
column11: Civil, Pharmacy, Commerce, Assistant Professor, Research, Management, Interior designing, Electricals, Teaching

column2: We are seeking a qualified Professor in the Department of ECE who will be responsible for teaching, research, and service. The ideal candidate will be passionate about their field of expertise and have a strong commitment to student success.           Responsibilities:         Teach undergraduate and graduate courses in the ECE department     Conduct research in areas related to ECE and publish papers in leading journals     Secure external research funding     Supervise graduate students and undergraduate research projects     Engage in service activities, including committee work and outreach to the community         Qualifications:         A Ph.D. in Electrical and Computer Engineering or a closely related field     Strong record of scholarly publications and external funding     Evidence of effective teaching and mentoring of students     Commitment to service and outreach activities     Ability to work collaboratively with faculty and students from diverse backgrounds     Knowledge and experience in areas such as electronics, communication systems, signal processing, embedded systems, computer architecture, and VLSI design.         Eligible fields:         Electronics     Communication Systems     Signal Processing     Embedded Systems     Computer Architecture     VLSI Design         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate
column11: Professor, Supervisor, Embedded systems, Computer architecture, Signal processing, Electronics, VLSI design, Research, Electricals, Teaching

column2: The Assistant Professor in the Department of MBA will be responsible for delivering high-quality teaching and research activities in MBA. The successful candidate will be expected to contribute to the departments vision of providing innovative solutions to the ever-changing needs of society. They will also have a crucial role in creating a platform for students to seize exponential opportunities, thereby facilitating them to become dynamic leaders.           Responsibilities:         Design and deliver lectures, tutorials, and practical classes in MBA for undergraduate and postgraduate students.     Develop and implement innovative teaching methodologies to enhance the learning experience of students.     Participate in research activities in the field of MBA and publish research findings in academic journals.     Guide and supervise students research projects, dissertations, and theses.      Participate in the departments administrative and organizational activities, such as curriculum design, assessment, and examination.     Foster collaborative partnerships with internal and external stakeholders, such as other departments, research institutes, and industry partners.             Qualifications:         A Ph.D. in MBA or a related field is required.      Demonstrated teaching experience in MBA or related subjects at the undergraduate and/or postgraduate levels.      A strong track record of research achievements and publications in peer-reviewed academic journals.     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and students.      Demonstrated commitment to providing quality education and developing innovative solutions to the ever-changing needs of society.             Eligible fields:         Marketing      Human Resource Management     Finance      Accounting      Strategic Management     Entrepreneurship                 Note:                   Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate.
column11: Strategic management, Business administration, Supervisor, Administration, Accounting, Manager Technology, Assistant Professor, Research, Human resource management, Teaching

column2: NIET, Greater Noida is looking to hire  Assistant Professor / Associate Professor / Professor  in the department of  CSE/CSE-Emerging Technologies/IT/MCA . Candidates having teaching experience in  preferred areas of expertise  including Internet of Things (IoT), Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cyber Security, Data Science, Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), Cloud Computing and Information Technology (IT) are highly preferred. The hired candidate will be responsible for various activities based on the position, including: Academic Activities Research, Development & Consultancy Administration Extension Services , etc. Designation, Qualification and Salary will be determined as per AICTE guidelines. Fresher with relevant qualification may also apply for the position of Assistant Professor. Apply Now!  You can submit your job applications to recruitment@niet.co.in also.

column2: We are seeking highly qualified individuals to join our faculty team as Professor, Associate Professor, or Assistant Professor. The ideal candidates will have expertise in fostering academic excellence across various functional areas, including QT, HR, Operations, Analytics, Supply Chain Management, and Strategic Management. As a member of our faculty, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the educational experiences of our students, contributing to research initiatives, and upholding our institution's academic standards. Role & responsibilities   Teach courses at the undergraduate and/or graduate level, utilizing innovative teaching methods to engage students and promote active learning. Develop and deliver curriculum content that reflects current industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in the field. Mentor and advise students on academic and career-related matters, providing guidance and support to help them achieve their goals. Conduct research and scholarly activities in your area of expertise, publishing articles in peer-reviewed journals, presenting at conferences, and contributing to the academic community. Collaborate with colleagues to design interdisciplinary courses, projects, and initiatives that enhance the overall learning experience for students. Participate in academic governance, committee work, and other service activities to contribute to the effective functioning of the department and the institution. Stay informed about developments in the field through professional development activities, networking opportunities, and continuing education. Preferred candidate profile   Professors   Ph.D with 10 to 15 years of experience Associate Professors   Ph.D with 5 to 10 years of experience Assistant Professors   3 to 5 years of experience (Ph.D. preferable /registered) (HR, Operations, Analytics, Supply Chain Management, Strategic Management) Professors - Training and Placements   Any Master's Degree with 5 to 15 years of experience with corporate exposure and network. Need to work in Bangalore, Chennai, and Hyderabad. Marketing Officers/HR Officers/Admin Officers/Admission Officers  ??5 to 10 years of experience (Must have MBA degree) Eligibility for appointment at the appropriate rank (Professor, Associate Professor, or Assistant Professor) based on qualifications and experience. Demonstrated expertise in QT, HR, Operations, Analytics, Supply Chain Management, or Strategic Management, with a strong record of research, teaching, and professional accomplishments. Previous experience teaching at the university level and a proven ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to diverse audiences. Commitment to fostering academic excellence, promoting student success, and contributing to the advancement of knowledge in the field. Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues, students, and external stakeholders. Evidence of scholarly productivity, including publications, presentations, grants, awards, or other forms of recognition. Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in teaching, research, and service activities. Perks and benefits   Competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with qualifications and experience. Opportunities for professional development, research support, and collaboration with colleagues. Access to state-of-the-art facilities, resources, and technology to support teaching and research activities. A supportive and inclusive work environment that values diversity, creativity, and innovation. Opportunities for leadership and advancement within the institution.
column11: Professors, QT, HR, Supply Chain, Analytics, Teaching, Lecturer Activities, Professor Activities, Education, Strategic Management, Associate Professors, Assistant Professor, Supply Chain Management, Operations

column1: Professor in School of Computing at DIT University, Dehradun
column2: Professor: School of Computing Minimum 10 years of experience in Teaching/Industry/ Research Organisations/Professional at the Managerial level excluding the period spent on obtaining the research degree, with post-Ph.D. experience of 10 years and a minimum of 5 years of experience as an Associate Professor. Minimum 15 research papers published in refereed Indexed Journals of high impact factor. Authored Books/Monographs/Reports (Desirable), of reputed publishers. In addition to the above, they should have experience in guiding project works/dissertations of PG/ Research students or supervising R&D projects in the industry. Should have demonstrated leadership in planning and organizing academic, research, industrial, and /or professional activities. Should have the capacity to undertake/lead sponsored R&D Projects, Consultancy, and related activities. Specializations: Robotics, Reinforcement Learning, Machine Learning, Data Science and Engineering Networking, Mobile Sensing, Internet of Things and Edge Computing, Cybersecurity, IoT Security, Cloud and Web Security, Cryptography and Privacy Computer Vision, Image Processing, Blockchain, Cloud Computing, Programming Languages: Java Programming, Python, Mobile Application Programming, Advanced JavaScript Framework, Oops, and Full Stack Development.   Interested candidates are requested to apply only through the below-mentioned link. https://dituniversity.keka.com/careers/applyjob/851

column2: Kamineni Hospitals is looking for Emergency Physician to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.An Emergency Physician is a medical doctor who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of medical emergencies. Their job involves the following responsibilities:     Patient assessment: Emergency Physicians perform initial assessments of patients to determine the severity of their medical condition and the appropriate course of treatment.     Diagnosis: Emergency Physicians diagnose medical conditions and injuries, ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests such as blood work, x-rays, and CT scans.     Treatment: Emergency Physicians provide immediate medical treatment to stabilize patients and prevent further complications, including medication administration, wound care, and other medical interventions.     Admitting and discharging patients: Emergency Physicians admit patients to the hospital for further treatment or discharge them with appropriate follow-up instructions
column11: opd, operations management, emergency medicine, critical care, diagnosis, medication administration, hospital administration, patient care, healthcare, ct, hospital operations, hospital management, quality management, casualty, doctor activities

column2: We are seeking a highly qualified and experienced professor for the Department of Obstetrical and Gynaecological Nursing. Administration: You may serve on departmental or university committees to help with administrative tasks such as accreditation, faculty recruitment, and budget planning.     Continuing education: You may be responsible for organizing and participating in continuing education programs for OBG professionals to help them stay up-to-date with new developments in the field.     Outreach: You may participate in community outreach programs to raise awareness about womens health issues and promote OBG education and care. column1: Assistant Professor - School of Liberal Arts
column2: Ph.D. with at least 15 years of experience of Professor/Principal with minimum aggregate teaching experience of 15 years      Or      Research Scientist of Grade-F with minimum aggregated research experience of 10 years      Or      Research Scientist or Professional from the industrial sector with a proven minimum aggregate industrial/Entrepreneurial experience of 15 years in the process of establishment of an Enterprise/industry and formation and execution of collaborations/linkages at National/ International University or Institution or Industry.            He shall be responsible for creation and cultivation of an enabling environment to propagate the concept of innovation, for converting innovative ideas into working models through a process of incubation which shall finally lead to creation of an enterprise and to cultivate, establish, maintain and strengthen the link of the university with premier national and international universities and institutions. He shall work directly under the superintendence, direction and control of the Vice-Chancellor.                Roles and Responsibilities             The Director of Innovation, Incubation and Linkages shall,          (a) be the principal officer who shall lead and provide vision to the Centre for Innovation, Incubation and Enterprise with his dynamism and enterprise;          (b) spearhead the awareness and training programmes for imparting education on intellectual property rights and aspects associated therewith;          (c) organize training programmes for creating awareness on the importance of entrepreneurship;          (d) organize and create support system for cultivation and incubation of good ideas into a scalable mode that would eventually culminate into the establishment of small, medium and large industry;          (e) work towards creating a liaison with national and international bodies and agencies involved in creating and developing entrepreneurial skills in students;          (f) take all steps to facilitate colleges to establish linkages with knowledge based and other types of industries;          (g) conduct training programmes to guide the young entrepreneurs in operational aspects, legal aspects, intellectual property rights, patent related issues, business model creation and financial aspects;          (h) implement the policies and strategies for promotion of international linkages with premier national and international universities and institutions, as envisaged by the Board of National and International Linkages and the university authorities;          (i) process applications for visits of teachers and students from university departments, institutions, conducted colleges, colleges and recognized institutions to national and international universities or institutions and assist them on logistic support for such visits;          (j) oversee and monitor administration of Foreign Students Assistance Cell which gives facility of a Single Window Operation to the foreign students;          (k) process the applications received from foreign students for their visits to other parts of India;          (l) supervise the working of the Migrant Indian Students Cell established for providing Single Window Operation for students coming from other parts of the country;          (m) undertake any other task that may be assigned to him by the university authorities, to ensure that the objectives of the Board for Innovation, Incubation and Enterprise and Board of National and International Linkages are accomplished;          (n) exercise such other powers and perform such other duties, as prescribed by or under this Act or assigned to him by the Vice-Chancellor from time to time.
